projects.title: Welcome to the Magic Kingdom
projects.detail: React application that draws Magic Kingdom attraction locations on a Google map. Will also display attraction details from Foursquare when selected.

projects.title: My Reads Virtual Bookshelf
projects.detail: Simple React GoodReads clone to keep track of books you've read, books you want to read, and books you're currently reading.

projects.title: Frogger Clone
projects.detail: Cross the grass and reach the water! Avoid bugs along the way. Written in JavaScript.

projects.title: @trumpratings on Twitter
projects.detail: Python application that culls @readDonaldTrump's twitter feed and latest Gallup approval ratings. Retweets latest post with latest ratings. Stores data in PostgreSQL database.

projects.title: Reddit/Facebook Sharing Integration
projects.detail: Will message latest upvoted Reddit post to a Facebook user of your choice. Python on PostgreSQL.

bio.top: I’m a California native, replanted from Chicago.
bio.middle:
I started from the ground up, working helpdesk to get through college.
After moving to California I found myself doing Windows/Linux system administration.
From there, I managed a help desk team. Finally I worked on deployment automation,
particularly for Atlassian applications running on RHEL/CentOS servers.
I’ve come back around and am writing Python. I finished a Udacity nanodegree
for front end development courtesy of Google via the Grow With Google scholarship.
Find me writting JavaScript (This site runs on Angular 6, but I know React too!) or Python. I'm planning to learn Node.js as well to round out my stack.
bio.bottom: Thanks for stopping by and let’s get in touch!
